concept.title: Posting User Permissions to External Systems (Optional)
concept.shortdesc: Livefyre uses a PUSH interface to send an external system information about changes to user permissions.

table.title: Types of Users in Livefyre Studio

entry.p: This user is an owner, and can both moderate content, and assign new moderators.
This user is a moderator, and can moderate content.
This user is whitelisted. Posted content does not pass through spam or profanity filters, and does not require approval in pre-moderated streams.
This user is a standard user, and has no special permissions.
This user has been banned from participating in any conversations.

conbody.p: To post user permissions to external systems, you must register a URL that receives permissions data as POST requests.
The URL registered should accept POSTs with the following data as content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

entry.p: JID of the user whose affiliation is changed. A JID is a string of the form user_id@network.
Name of the permissions assigned, which must be one of the following: {admin | member | none | outcast | owner}

conbody.p: For additional information on updating user affiliation settings, see the Add User Affiliation API Reference.
